title: Dinner Tonight: Red Snapper With Tomatoes And Olives Baked In Foil
summary: Dinner Tonight: Red Snapper With Tomatoes And Olives Baked In Foil is a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal main course. This recipe serves 3 and costs $2.37 per serving. One serving contains 234 calories, 24g of protein, and 13g of fat. 3 people were glad they tried this recipe. If you have plum tomatoes, kalamatan olives, olive oil, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 26 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 89%, this dish is outstanding. Try Dinner Tonight: Whitefish Baked with Tomatoes, Olives, and Capers, Dinner Tonight: Pan-Roasted Whole Fish with Olives, and Red Snapper with Tomatoes, Olives and Onions for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Anne Amie Pinot Gris with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 14 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Anne Amie Pinot Gris
productMatches.description:
Aromas of Bartlett pear, gardenia, white peach, white tea, jasmine, graham cracker, and straw. Flavors of Asian pear, white fig, white peach, white strawberry, and fennel flowers. The finish is dry, long and acid driven.
Pairs well with roast chicken, Caesar salad, mussels, quince glazed pork chop, grilled squash, pan seared trout, and bibimbap.
